content: I don't have the ability to directly communicate with real people. however, based on available information, former college athletes who support a unionization movement are generally frustrated with the ncaa's actions thus far. many advocate for increased rights and protections for collegiate athletes, including better healthcare and compensation for their labor. some have criticized the ncaa for being resistant to change and for not valuing the well-being of their athletes above profits. despite the obstacles, however, many former athletes remain committed to advocating for the rights of college athletes and the formation of a union.
